properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 5:16AM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
An upper-level disturbance moving eastward across the region early
this morning continued to bring light snow to much of the region
west of the Blue Ridge. This will continue for a few more hours,
then diminish as the disturbance moves northeast of the region.

Snow is generally very light and temperatures are only near or
below freezing in the higher elevations west of the Blue Ridge
with temperatures above freezing for many locations east of the
Blue Ridge, namely in the mid to upper 30s. Thus, snow accumulations
are expected to remain light ranging from a dusting to perhaps an
inch at some isolated higher elevations locations in the western
mountains.

Even though this is a light snow event and no advisories are
currently in effect, light snow occurring around the rush hour
could result in unexpected traffic issues. In areas where
temperatures are near or below freezing, untreated roads,
highways, and sidewalks could become slick and hazardous this
morning, including during the morning commute. If you plan to
travel between now and 10 AM this morning, allow extra time to
reach your destination, reduce speed, and use extra caution in
areas where the roads are covered with snow.

Road and highway conditions will improve quickly once the snow
ends later this morning and temperatures warm above freezing.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or commercial radio and
television for the latest weather information.

NWSheadline: Light Snow Continuing Early This Morning
